headline: With Oscars Looming, ‘1917’ Makes Its Case Atop the Box Office
abstract: The war epic collected about $37 million over the weekend, a stellar result for a period film with no marquee stars. “Just Mercy” and “Like a Boss” each took in $10 million.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Since the Academy Awards began more than nine decades ago, films have had to thread two needles to win the best picture statuette: art and commerce. Netflix’s business model is changing that dynamic: “The Irishman” officially has ticket sales of zero, since the streaming service does not release movies in a traditional way. But over the weekend, with the war epic “1917,” came an old-fashioned example of a film delivering both artistic wows and big ticket sales.
